gridit's just flow

The fleXGH grid is quite simple, just think about the direction of your element on the page.

By default, every element is a column if its grid class is omitted

Classes:

.row: If it's horizontal or has itens side by side, is a row;

.col: Otherwhise, if is vertical or has a vertical content, is a column;

.center: This class centralize the inner elements, putting space around them;

.start: This one pull the inner elements to the start. The left if it's a row. The top if it's a column;

.end: The opposite of the above, pulling the inner elements to the end. In this case the bottom in columns or the right in rows;

.strech: It's like the name, this class stretch the element to fill all the available space in his father.

Bordersbecause we need [too]

We can add borders easily just add a couple of classes on the element with this utility.

By default, the classes below adds 1px solid borders, the color of the border can be earely changed with our color classes.

Classes:

.bt: adds border-top

.bl: adds border-left

.bb: adds border-bottom

.br: adds border-right

.by: adds border on top and bottom

.bx: adds border on both sides

Last Update:2017-07-03
spaceslittle adjustments

Its extremely simple, just worry about the direction and flow of your page.

Its extremely simple, just worry about the direction and flow of your page.

Classes:

.[margin or padding][position]-[how much]: It can look a little complex, but is easy to understand. Look some exemples:

.mx-3: sets margin-left and right (x-axis) equals a 3rem;

.ml-8: sets margin-left equals a 8rem;

.py-2: sets padding-botom and top (y-axis) equals a 2rem;

.pt-4: sets padding-top equals a 4rem;

.mt-7: sets margin-top equals a 7rem;

.pr-2: sets padding-right equals a 2rem;

.mb-0: sets margin-botom equals a 0;

Last Update:2017-07-03
responsivewe are mobile

Easy setable breakpoits, just choose where you want to brak and stack everything.

For now, we have 3 sizes of breakpoints.

Classes:

.s: breakpoint on small screens. Such as most of smartphones;

.m: breakpoint on medium screens. Like tablets and some smartphones too;

.g: breakpoint on large screens. All desktops and above.
